name: MistralAIModel

input.content:
I have a webpage that's open in a chrome browser but the page no longer exists. 
What javascript should I type in the console to get a copy of the entire page html?

output:
You can use the following JavaScript code in the Chrome Developer Console to get a copy of the entire page HTML:

```javascript
let html = document.documentElement.outerHTML;
console.log(html);
```

This code gets the `outerHTML` of the `documentElement` (which is the entire HTML document), saves it to the `html` variable, and then logs it to the console.

Please note that this method might not work perfectly if the page has iframes or shadow DOM elements. Also, some dynamic content might not be captured if it's not currently rendered.

After running the code, you'll see the HTML in the console. You can right-click on the logged HTML and select "Store as global variable" (e.g., `temp1`) to save it as a variable. Then you can easily copy the variable's content:

1. Type `copy(temp1)` in the console.
2. Press Enter, and the HTML content will be copied to your clipboard.

name: WordEvaluator
input:
You can use the following JavaScript code in the Chrome Developer Console to get a copy of the entire page HTML:

```javascript
let html = document.documentElement.outerHTML;
console.log(html);
```

This code gets the `outerHTML` of the `documentElement` (which is the entire HTML document), saves it to the `html` variable, and then logs it to the console.

Please note that this method might not work perfectly if the page has iframes or shadow DOM elements. Also, some dynamic content might not be captured if it's not currently rendered.

After running the code, you'll see the HTML in the console. You can right-click on the logged HTML and select "Store as global variable" (e.g., `temp1`) to save it as a variable. Then you can easily copy the variable's content:

1. Type `copy(temp1)` in the console.
2. Press Enter, and the HTML content will be copied to your clipboard.
